content: So the acft collides with something and crashes and that causes it to suck. Do not underestimate the potential of the SU-35. Remember, we have suffered crashes in EVERY major fighter purchase. This one event is not an indicator of how well the acft will perform. A F-22 prototype crashed due to flghht control software issue, but yet the program went on. A F-14 crashed in Long Isald during that program's infancy, but yet they did well for over 30 years.
reply: So the acft collides with something and crashes and that causes it to suck. Do not underestimate the potential of the SU-35. Remember, we have suffered crashes in EVERY major fighter purchase. This one event is not an indicator of how well the acft will perform. A F-22 prototype crashed due to flghht control software issue, but yet the program went on. A F-14 crashed in Long Isald during that program's infancy, but yet they did well for over 30 years.
title: Ha! Russia's new superweapon sucks!

content: What is amazing is that the information even got out. Years ago, such events were hushed up for years or forever - - The most glaring example of that was when someone got hold of a "current" map of the Soviet Union and compared it with a map of Russia circa 1917... Close scrutiny discovered that a whole are was devoid of towns where there used to be many. The conclusion was two-fold, either a site for the disposal of nuclear waste had somehow gone "critical" and caused a very nasty, dirty low order nuclear blast; or one of their 50 Megaton bomb-carrying missiles exploded on the pad or in the silo, and contaminated the whole area... To this day, the area is only marginally used for Military Train Wandering and Wondering

content: quote: Originally posted by m551sheridan: Re: Plane Crashes into ground. Isn't this a photo from several years ago? Something is ringing a bell in the ol'noggin about this being on the news a ways back. Yeh, Russian was showing the great "Cobra" move, blew a motor, causing the jet to carthwheel sideways and become a lawn dart just meters off the ground... Moral to the story: Ya show off, ya pay!! The second one is after a collision when two Russians learn ya can't put two jets in the same piece of air at the same time without having a bad day - But some times, even Americans have a bad day - ahey Wandering and Wondering
